description:
Ranch Style Living with Great Views
If affordable lifestyle living is your dream then this home is well worth your time to inspect. On a corner allotment of approximately 8 acres with leasing available on a further 2 acres at nominal cost, this home is warm and inviting.
Suitable for horses amongst other options, the land is divided into 6 paddocks and is fully fenced and gated. There is an industrial sized shed approx. 15m x 12m, 5 outdoor undercover stable yards and water available to the paddocks.
This stunning ranch style home contains 4 large bedrooms, a country style kitchen and bathroom which includes a corner spa, a slow combustion wood burner and a split system that allows year-round comfort.
The entrance to the home is laid with slate that continues to solid timber boards throughout adding to the country theme. One key feature of the home is a massive private decking and alfresco area overlooking your own land. The property has water tanks, dam water and town water.

COUNTRY LIFE AT ITS BEST
Located approx 15 minutes drive from Maryborough and approx. 35 minutes drive to Ballarat this lifestyle property provides a great opportunity to enjoy the benefits of country living. The timber home features four bedrooms, lounge with solid fuel heater, kitchen and dining with electric hot plates and wall oven, bathroom with shower over spa bath, laundry and all round verandah. A separate bungalow with power close to the house adds additional space to utilise. The surrounding approx. 13 acres of land features plenty of shedding including double carport, double garage with large shed, storage shed, animal enclosures, large dam and paddocks for livestock. The property is well positioned to enjoy the picture perfect country views. Why not make the move to the country and experience a healthy and relaxed lifestyle. Inspection by appointment.

Picturesque Parcel in Very Popular Resort
This attractive allotment is found in the executive golf course estate RACV Goldfields Resort. The parcel measures approximately 508m2 and has a great frontage of 19.87 meters. With these proportions your dream home, weekender or investment property can be generous in size. As expected with a young estate, all services are connected to the parcel. The block is just a pitching wedge from two fairways and a difficult 3 iron to the 19th Hole to enjoy the bar, restaurant and picturesque views over the course. On the Ballarat side of town and a quick escape to Melbourne the locale is very convenient. Those wishing to enjoy the comforts and facilities of Creswick will find the hub of town just 3 minutes away. With all other allotments having sold quickly of recent times, be sure to call soon.
* This information has been prepared to assist solely in the marketing of this property. While all care has been taken to ensure the information provided herein is correct, we do not take responsibility for any inaccuracies. Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.

Fantastic Family Home, So Much to Offer
Perfectly designed for a graduated block, this elevated brick veneer 80s home sits on a massive 1,616m2 of land with a bluestone driveway, an under-house garage, a side carport along with sensational views over the township.
To the rear there is a fully fenced inground swimming pool, an open alfresco area, a big brick veneer shed with connected water tank and expansive lawns for children or pets to play.
Internally, the home features warm tones with cosy carpet, ceilings fans, central heating, and a gas log fire. This iconic design boasts a sunken lounge, a study nook, a formal dining zone and an arched entry to the pretty pink kitchen with outstanding over-the-sink views. Beyond the kitchen there is a further dining zone for entertaining, while up three stairs the accommodation begins.
The master bedroom is designed with walk in robe and retro ensuite, two further bedrooms, a family bathroom with spa and an independent laundry with garden access.
An additional room is located on the ground level, while the front balcony delivers exceptional Creswick views framed by ever changing established trees and gardens.

The Fresh Country Lifestyle of Newlyn, the perfect escape!
Located in the ever-popular hamlet of Newlyn, 15 minutes to Daylesford and 10 to Creswick and set on just under 2.5acres and featuring three crown allotments, this Light filled and very charming north facing country property provides many lifestyle options with its warm relaxed feel, perfect for the country weekender, the city escape or new home.
Feel the warmth of the open fire or the convenience of central heating as you relax in this charming country property just watching the days go past.
The property comprising two good size bedrooms both with BIRs, living room with wood fire and recently renovated bathroom (with separate bath) and also recently renovated kitchen that is warmed by an Esse wood fired stove which can also heat your hot water.
Outside in the low maintenance but spacious yard with ample shedding you will also find raised vegetable garden beds, fruit trees, established country style gardens and yet there is still ample space for the new owners to expand the gardens and put their stamp on it.
Not to mention the beautiful hedge.
Those requiring shedding can appreciate the three door 16 x 10 meter shed, perfect for any hobby or storage.
The property has recently been reroofed, rewired, has a Well connected via pump for garden watering Town services include town power and water, internet is NBN wireless.
With lifestyle homes at an all-time high demand in regional Victoria, inspect today. call today to arrange for a private inspection.

The former Dean Hotel, country living!
This heritage listed property sits in the small hamlet of Dean beautifully located 26kms from Daylesford, 10 kms from Creswick and 20 kms from Ballarat. Rich in history, originally the Dean Hotel circa 1870s, this home was fully renovated in 2012 retaining key original features while tastefully refurbishing the rest. The property offers two large living areas, one with dining, separated by a spacious bar with its own cellar. Exposed bricks, high ceilings, new wood combustion heater, lovely views and amazing sunsets highlight these very generously proportioned rooms. The kitchen is an entertainers dream- large with a central work space including a gas nine burner and oven, Smeg appliances, plenty of bench space (thick ceasar stone) and storage, reverse cycle split system and has direct access to the dining area as well as French doors to the back garden. Along the hall you will find 2 large bedrooms, one with a gas log fire and double barn slide doors, the other with two entrances, ensuite and reverse cycle split system, plus a large central bathroom with bath and toilet, and an additional separate powder room. A good size laundry completes the interior. Sitting on 1196sqm, there is a gated entrance to the front of the property with room for 3 cars, further gates to the rear enclosing the large back garden which has direct access to the reserve bordering the east end of the property. In the back garden there is a good size multi purpose shed, lovely large trees and plenty of space to sit out in or for children to play. There is the classic old hotel style verandah to the east and south sides of the home.
This property would suit an exceptional private home, a luxury weekend retreat, a home/office/studio - your choice, your possibility!
Features:
Great location with nearby freeway access
Heritage listed circa 1870
Large main living area with new wood combustion heater
Spacious bar with its own cellar
Large living area and dining area with kitchen access
Entertainers kitchen with central work space, gas nine burner, smeg appliances including electric oven & dishwasher, bench space, storage, reverse cycle
French doors off kitchen to back garden
Separate door to side verandah
Good sized laundry off kitchen
Large master with two door entrances, reverse cycle split system, ensuite
Large second bedroom with double barn slide doors, gas log fire
Good size central bathroom with bath
Powder room
Large back garden fully fenced with personal access to reserve
Multi-purpose shed
Gated front garden for 3-4 cars
Exposed bricks
High ceilings
Floorboards throughout

Lifestyle, Location, Low Maintenance
Modern style, convenient position and exceptional space define this comfortable easy-care contemporary home to the North of Creswick's beautiful main street.
Perfectly matched to a relaxing low-maintenance lifestyle, this fully fenced grand allotment of approx. 1,227m2 provides a modern three bedroom family home with attached double garage, an open fronted 6x6m shed with concrete floor, and the convenience of a corner allotment to access with ease.
This well considered home showcases a spacious, light filled living zone perfectly linked to the open plan kitchen with island bench, ample storage and a 900mm stainless steel cooker and rangehood.
This zone directly accesses the covered outdoor deck; perfect for alfresco enjoyment surrounded by verdant lawns and well-established trees dotted around the yard.
Accommodation comprises of a double-door entry master bedroom complete with ensuite and two further robed bedrooms serviced by the family bathroom, a separate toilet and independent laundry.
Solar hot water lightens the power bill, while a freestanding combustion heater and a split system comfort the home with complete ease.
Soaked in natural light and brimming with modern fittings, fixtures and decor tones, this home is impressive with an outstanding country allotment highlighted by distant country views.

Sit under the trees and let the world go by.
With lightly scattered trees to open pasture, this lovely approx. 34-acre block of land nestled at Amherst only minutes from the popular market town of Talbot.
Whatever the weather, enjoy all the land has to offer, paddle your feet in the dam, or sit under the trees and let the world go by. Park the caravan or pitch the tent. Only 2 hours from the bustle of Melbourne, Amherst is the ideal area to escape.
Visit the many surrounding wineries, throughout the Pyrenees. Or if you like take a hike, trek the many tracks of Bung Bong Nature Reserve, Talbot Nature Reserve, or the Paddy Ranges.
Features include:
Fully fenced
X2 Dams
Zoned Farming
STCA for planning permits
20 minutes to Maryborough
5 minutes to Talbot
17 minutes to Avoca
Inspection by appointment, to arrange please call Angela Flowers direct on 0437 456 908

Land to build with Beautiful landscape and Native bushland
Situated between in the highly prized location of Ballarat and Daylesford , this property bordering the Wombat State Forest presents ideal opportunity to build (STCA) or just enjoy the rural lifestyle.
- Combination of lovely rolling land with portion of beautiful native bushland on southern end.
- Sealed road frontage
- Four catchment dams, including one huge front dam
- Bore with windmill (not in use)
- Several ideal positions for building sites (STCA)
Secure your dream lifestyle block now!
DEPOSIT: 10%
SETTLEMENT: 30/60 days
*please note there is a another 54 acres with dwelling right beside which can be purchased together. There is a subdivision permit in its final stages of approval from the Hepburn Shire; a divisional fence has been erected between the two lots by the owner.

Lifestyle escape! 54 acres (21.94ha) and Classic Homestead
Situated between in the highly prized location of Ballarat and Daylesford with a stunning rural backdrop and tranquillity by the truckload, this property bordering the Wombat State Forest has opportunity galore.
- Formerly Rocky Lead State School teacher's residence, classic early 1900's 3BR original weatherboard farmhouse with charming light fittings, cornices, high ceilings and period features.
- Two living areas with open fireplaces, wood oven, scenic country outlooks from most windows
- Large machinery shed, dairy/barn, cattle-yards and ramp, 3 bay open machinery shed, hayshed and several other outbuildings
- Water supplied by tanks, bore and windmill and 3 dams, including lovely large spring-fed dam stocked with redfin.
Secure your dream lifestyle block now!
DEPOSIT: 10%
SETTLEMENT: 30/60 days
*please note there is a another 102 acres right beside which can be purchased together. There is a subdivision permit in its final stages of approval from the Hepburn Shire; a divisional fence has been erected between the two lots by the owner.

Original Miners Cottage With Development Potential
Seize this rare opportunity to purchase a quaint original miners cottage & a sizeable slice of land on the popular North side of central Creswick.
Sitting vacant for approx 10 years and ready to immediately improve, this country cottage is rich in character with four bedrooms, a family bathroom, an original kitchen, two living zones & an outdoor laundry with further toilet facilities.
The allotment of approximately 1,100m2 provides the perfect canvas to capitalize on its dual street access, with enough room to design & create two townhouses facing Pasco Street (STCA), while also offering the promising prospect to reinstate the beauty of the veranda cottage to Clunes Road to the front. A vine draped single carport sits to the rear of the property with a gated entrance to the front.
This unique offering and/or possible development site (STCA) requires some due diligence, yet just rolling up your sleeves to move straight in & consider its future possibilities is definitely without concerns.
Whether you take advantage of its thoroughfare position to Broomfield, Clunes or across to Daylesford, or just enjoy its convenient position close to Flemo's Milk Bar & the main street of Creswick, this property will certainly deliver many possibilities now & well into the future.
Contact the marketing agents for further information and to arrange an inspection.

Lifestyle opportunity on 70 acres with all the Ps- picturesque, panoramic, private, power and planning permit!
If you love the sound of living on 70 acres with panoramic views in a central location then look no further. Located in the fabulous Hepburn Shire with so much to see and do, not to mention the food and wine scene around Daylesford, this property is 3 mins to Smeaton Pub, 9 minutes to Kingston, 20 Minutes to Daylesford, 30 minutes to Ballarat, 12 minutes to Creswick for everyday shopping and the best French patisserie and 12 minutes to Clunes. So many options, what to do first! The land offers an established central driveway inclusive of a planted shelter belt, good pasture (currently agists cattle), is fully fenced with 7 paddocks and for the piece de resistance has a current council approved planning permit for a 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom home and a 50KVa power sub-station on the property. The property has a lovely vantage and the southern boundary runs along Birch Creek.
So much of the hard work has been done, there for the asking.

Prettiest of Finishes with a Locale of Convenience
A whole lot of heart and a great deal of work have gone into this renovated beauty. Meticulously brought back to better than new, the home has been re-roofed, re-wired, re-plumbed, freshly plastered, painted and lovely floor coverings added. On top of this, the residence has a picturesque French Provincial inspired kitchen with polished timber benchtops, a spacious modern bathroom, polished bamboo floorboards and stunning chandeliers. Boasting three generous bedrooms the home also has terrific storage. The north facing living room has wondrous natural light, a reverse cycle air-conditioner and is open plan to the dining room and kitchen. The area also has the option to be kept cosy via the gas log heater. Extremely functional, the kitchen delivers in not only style, but with the expected modern appliances and great bench & cupboard space. Just a short stroll to the train station, its locale also has you only a three-minute walk to the hub of town for shopping, dining or maybe one of your favourite coffee shops. Walking distance to childcare, Kinder, schools, public transport, seniors citizens, Lake Calembeen and all Creswick has to offer with a new purpose built supermarket for your convenience. All set on approximately 480m2. This cosy home is ready to move into immediately - even before settlement if you need to. New Colourbond fencing will be included and has already been booked in.
* This information has been prepared to assist solely in the marketing of this property. While all care has been taken to ensure the information provided herein is correct, we do not take responsibility for any inaccuracies. Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.

Well Presented Brick Veneer Home With Huge Shed
This impeccable single-level residence delivers a wonderful environment thanks to the expansive garden surrounds, the immaculate night-lit bitumen driveway and a massive shed to the rear.
Ready to simply move in and enjoy, this brick veneer home offers a free-flowing floorplan encompassing a generous living room with honey coloured timber floors and a freestanding wood heater, an electric wall heater, an adjoining dining zone and updated kitchen with stainless steel appliances along with two good size bedrooms all with built in robes, served by a family size bathroom with double shower, separate toilet and expansive laundry with garden access. This home also comes complete with a built in Cinema entertainment system.
Adding to the appeal, is a large brand new semi elevated deck creating further room to entertain outdoors, along with North & South verandas allowing you to move your relaxation spots all year round.
Occupying a wonderfully deep allotment of 787m2, this property is a real winner when it comes to ticking all the boxes. An impressive four car garage and workshop sit to one side, while linked garden sheds and a kindling shed accompany a huge water tank, a fenced off vegetable garden, a number of well established fruit trees (apple, cherry, and hazelnut) and new side fencing. This expansive yard is pet friendly and fully secure.
This property lies within metres from the Doug Lindsay Recreation Reserve along with minutes to the heart of the Creswick or a 15 minute commute onto Ballarat.

Beautiful Block In The Heart Of Smeaton
Set on approximately 2075m2 in the heart of Smeaton is this flat parcel of land ideal for your dream home to be built on.
The allotment is within walking distance to the local Hotel and the Tennis Courts and within an easy driving distance of Ballarat, Creswick, Daylesford and Trentham.
The established fruit trees have grown well due to the rich volcanic soil of the area. Included is a 9 x 6 metre steel shed which can be a workshop or double as a great shelter when used as a weekender.

Brilliant 54 acres between Ballarat and Daylesford
For Private sale: $520,000
Situated in the highly prized location just 20 minutes north-east of Ballarat and 15 minutes to Daylesford, is this opportunity to secure a brilliant block in the heartland of the scenic and productive horticultural district.
With a mix of rich red volcanic and grey loam soils, this property is fresh as a daisy having not been cropped or potatoes for many years. It is ideally suited and ready to go as an add-on to existing operation, livestock out- paddock or simply a wonderful lifestyle block (STCA).
The property which is majority arable has sealed road frontage and has a beautiful undulation in parts.
With one spring-fed dam and some lovely gums gathered in the central part of the property, much of the fencing has been renewed and is mostly in excellent condition.
DEPOSIT: 10%
SETTLEMENT: 30/60 days.

The project you have been waiting for!!!!
Visualise the potential this approx. 4.8 acres has set amid some quality homes. Located among bush and the pine plantation, there are some great tracks to drive, ride the bike or walk the dog
The parcel of land is zoned low density residential, and power and water available. Sculpt the block for your home (STCA), live on the fringe of town, and enjoy the privacy this block has to offer.

Charming Home in Arguably Creswick's Best Street
This Federation styled abode is sweet, tidy and feels like home. The Edwardian home still grants original features including ceiling roses and polished floorboards. There are two large bedrooms and an office or optional third bedroom. The sunny lounge, dining and kitchen are all inviting, while a private courtyard deck will cover your entertaining needs. There is all year comfort with the home also offering gas central heating and reverse cycle air conditioning. The laundry holds a second shower and vanity, maybe handy for the home tradesman. The residence is only two blocks from the hub of town and with its elevated position it has charming views across town and over to the surrounding hills of Creswick. A charismatic home, it can also promise a very tidy return for any investor looking to grow their port-folio.
* This information has been prepared to assist solely in the marketing of this property. While all care has been taken to ensure the information provided herein is correct, we do not take responsibility for any inaccuracies. Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.

All the Room, Shedding & Yard Space You Could Ever Need
This wonderful home is found in the ever-popular Newlyn just 15 minutes to Daylesford and closer still to Ballarat & Creswick. The home itself boasts the most generous proportions you may find in a home. The vast formal lounge and dining will have you hosting well over 20 guests when times permit. The open plan kitchen, meals and lounge continues the spacious feel and has your guests then lead out to the enclosed pergola area. Any home chef would be delighted with this kitchen with the utmost amount of bench-space and pantry/cupboards. Throughout the abode there are four grand bedrooms. The king size master also displays a walk-in robe and full ensuite. The family bathroom will hold all the kids at the one time and there is a corner spa for a little relaxation. Set on over half an acre of land there is terrific yard space for pets, backyard cricket and more. Those requiring shedding can appreciate the double garage along with the 14 x 6 meter four bay shed. With lifestyle homes at an all-time high demand in regional Victoria, inspect today.
* This information has been prepared to assist solely in the marketing of this property. While all care has been taken to ensure the information provided herein is correct, we do not take responsibility for any inaccuracies. Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.

A Wonderful Lifestyle Awaits! Set On Approx 1 Acre With 3 Acre Grazing Licence
Virtually across the road from the Doug Lindsay Recreation Reserve and with a large green space next door, this Dennis family home will fulfil your entire dreams when it comes to family living.
Showcasing exceptional fittings and fixtures, this four-bedroom home is filled with light with timber like floors, crisp white plantation shutters, a split system, ,solar hot water and a stainless wood heater to keep the home completely comfortable.
An open plan living dining zone overlooks a black and white kitchen equipped with a large butler's pantry, stainless steel appliances, a large peninsular waterfall island bench along with a further living area or rumpus room for children's play or relaxation.
The luxuriously carpeted master bedroom boasts an impressively large double vanity ensuite with walk in robe, while the three additional bedrooms are served by a modern family bathroom, separate toilet and laundry with garden access.
Outdoor features include an alfresco with gardens to the front and rear, a double garage plus sweeping around the 'L' shaped block a massive shed to house further vehicles with high clearance entry for a caravan or boat.
Sitting on approx 4,781m2, this property not only provides plenty of room ,also offering rear access from Voights St and a grazing licence to the neighbouring three acres which allows extra space for a pony or two

Opportunity Knocks In Creswick
Here is an opportunity to snap up one of two residential allotments in a popular location of beautiful Creswick. Sitting side by side and predominantly popular for families who commute through to Ballarat, this flat vacant allotment should be considered for your next real estate project or construction of your dream home.
With all town services available and offering approximately 763m2 of level land, this allotment is fenced to one side and the back and is within walking distance to all the town amenities, along with a handy bus stop just over the road.
A short 15 minutes will take you through to Ballarat or to connect with the Western Freeway, while Creswick is also popular due to its proximity to Daylesford, Castlemaine or Bendigo.
A great opportunity for those looking for a lovely country atmosphere or investors with an opportunity here to construct a single build or townhouses (STCA) as an investment project. Call our agent for further details and full land measurements.
